dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, I read this article, right? And it talks about how, like, we actually have two jobs, not just one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, I read this article, right? And it talks about how, like, we actually have two jobs, not just one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is why it is so critical to understand that you have two jobs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, interesting. Two jobs? [chuckles] Um, like a side hustle, or... what do you mean?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, interesting. Two jobs? Um, like a side hustle, or... what do you mean?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, no. It's more philosophical, I guess. It says 'Job No. 1' is where you're totally self-centered. Like, you devalue relationships, you only think about your own interests.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no. It's more philosophical, I guess. It says Job No. one is where you're totally self-centered. Like, you devalue relationships, you only think about your own interests.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Job no. 1 forces you to value relationships and be other-centered. Instead of thinking first about your own self-interest, you think first about the interests of others: clients, peers, and even your boss.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. So, like, the classic "what's in it for me" kind of attitude?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. So, like, the classic what's in it for me kind of attitude?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! You're constantly looking for ways to, like, detract value, instead of actually helping clients or your peers, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! You're constantly looking for ways to, like, detract value, instead of actually helping clients or your peers, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You constantly look for new ways to add value, and in the process, you become much more useful to the people around you.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. That's, uh, that's pretty bleak. So then what's 'Job No. 2'?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. That's, uh, that's pretty bleak. So then what's Job No. two?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, 'Job No. 2' is what actually pays the bills. It's how you feed your family, you know, pursue the agenda of the people who hired you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Job No. two is what actually pays the bills. It's how you feed your family, you know, pursue the agenda of the people who hired you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Job no. 2 is how you get paid, feed your family, and pursue the agenda of the people who hired you.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so that's the obvious one. But I can see how Job No. 1 would totally screw up Job No. 2, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so that's the obvious one. But I can see how Job No. one would totally screw up Job No. two, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! It says Job No. 1 makes you much worse at Job No. 2. It ruins relationships, disconnects you.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! It says Job No. one makes you much worse at Job No. two. It ruins relationships, disconnects you.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Job no. 1 does not compete with job no. 2. Job no. 1 makes you much better at job no. 2. It builds stronger relationships. It connects you more strongly to others.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] So then, what are we supposed to do? Like, just ignore Job No. 1?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So then, what are we supposed to do? Like, just ignore Job No. one?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, this is the kicker. It says to not really take *either* job seriously in the traditional sense. It's about being genuinely helpful to others.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, this is the kicker. It says to not really take either job seriously in the traditional sense. It's about being genuinely helpful to others.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Take both jobs seriously. Invest equal energy in each.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, so, like, instead of being selfish, you help people who *can't* help you back in your main job?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so, like, instead of being selfish, you help people who can't help you back in your main job?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! It says if you do that, you'll be seen as genuine and selfless. Like, that person who returns your calls when you're looking for a job, not just when you have one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! It says if you do that, you'll be seen as genuine and selfless. Like, that person who returns your calls when you're looking for a job, not just when you have one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If you only help people who can help you in job no. 2, you will soon be revealed as a superficial and somewhat manipulative person. You know the type... someone who is eager to help you when you have a big job, but who won't return your phone calls when you are looking for a job. Don't be that person.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. That's a really different way to look at it. So it's not just about the paycheck, then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. That's a really different way to look at it. So it's not just about the paycheck, then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. It argues that not every reward is financial. Some actions, um, they starve your soul, they deplete your community.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. It argues that not every reward is financial. Some actions, um, they starve your soul, they deplete your community.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Not every reward is financial. Some actions feed your soul, enrich your community, and model the sort of behaviors you want your peers, friends, and family members to emulate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, true success isn't just about what's on your bank statement at the end of the month?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, true success isn't just about what's on your bank statement at the end of the month?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's a much wider vision of, like, why you're actually here, you know? It really got me thinking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. It's a much wider vision of, like, why you're actually here, you know? It really got me thinking.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It's not enough to succeed at the job that pays your bills. That is simply too narrow a vision of the reason you are here on Earth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, me too. I guess I've been thinking about my jobs all wrong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, me too. I guess I've been thinking about my jobs all wrong.
